headline.main: THE EUROPA'S MAILS.; Extracts From our Foreign Files.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Europa's mails arrived last night. They contain very little however of special interest. We gve the following extracts from our English files: English Views of the Reciprocity Treaty. From the London Times, Sept. 10. Few events of this year, even though the list should include a brilliant victory, will leave greater occasion for true and permanent satisfaction than the completion of what is termed the Reci-

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; THE BROOME-STREET MURDER. Coroner's Investigation--The Culprit yet at Largo. COURT OF GENERAL SESSIONS--OCTOBER TERM--TENTH DAY--Oct. 13. INFRINGING THE EMIGRATION LAWS. TESTIMONY. SUPREME COURT--SPECIAL TERM.

docs.lead_paragraph: An inquest was held yesterday afternoon, by Corner O'DONNELL, in the Fourteenth Ward Station house, on the body of GEORGE DE COOTE, (not RICKERT,) the employe of the Harlem Railroad Company, who was killed by being pushed off a passenger, is Broome-street, on Thursday evening.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the modest. unpretending garb of an Almanac, Dr. S. S FITCH, No 714 Broadway, in this City, has recently published a remarkable pamphlet. If considered simple with re ?? to its literary merits or its artistic design and execution, one may perhaps find in it nothing to specially arrest attention But in perusing the extraordinary statements it certains, fully supported, as those statements are, by vouchers of unquestionable authenticity.

headline.main: The Yellow Fever at New-Orleans--South Carolina and Florida Elections.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Southern mail, as late as due from all points, is received. The health of New Orleans was improving. The deaths from yellow fever at the Hospital during the week had been only 70, against 100 in the previous week. There had also been a great abatement in the disease in private practice.

docs.lead_paragraph: ANOTHER PHYSICIAN GONE!--It will be seen by the list of interments published to day, that Dr. JAS. M. GORDON has been snatched from us in the midst of his usefulness, by the unsparing hand of death.

headline.main: OREGON.; General Condition of Affairs--The Election--Disconveries of Gold--The Weather, Crops. AN INTERESTING LETTER.

docs.lead_paragraph: According to the official returns of the late election in this Territory, it appears that our next Legislature will consist of twenty-three Loces and six Whigs in the Honse, and seven Loces and two Whigs in the Council. The whole number of votes cast upon the Convention question was 7,289--majority against Convention, 869.

docs.lead_paragraph: Among the faults of the day, there is not one deserving of more decided consure than the habit of "slashing writing." That it is growing upon our people, and especially the newspaper press, cannot be doubted. Arguments cannot now be trusted to their truth, nor rhetoric to its refined taste. They must be put in a slashing manner.

docs.lead_paragraph: A few days ago a woman, named Mrs. HUNTER, residing at Brax Woods, passed an animal of an extraordinary description. She imagines that it it has been in her stomach for upwards of six years, as during that period she had experienced novel and unpleasant sensations, which no remedy in the shape of medicine could remove, and of which she is now relieved.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; MURDER TRIAL. Trial of Charles Graham for the Murder of John Wilson. COURT OF OYER AND TERMINER THE DEFENCE. Dedication of the Fifth-avenue Protestant Reformed Dutch Church. Arrest for Passing Counterfelt Money. THE LATE BISHOP WAINWRIGHT. Memorial in His Henor. ACTION OF THE COMMITTEE OF THE DIOCESAN CONVENTION. Death by Burning Fluid. Amnsing Run onthe Mechanles' Bank. LAW INTELLIGENCE. SURROGATE'S COURT UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT. SUPREME COURT SUPERIOR COURT COURT OF COMMON PLEAS.

docs.lead_paragraph: Before Hon. Judge Mitchell. The Court opened this morning as usual at 10 o'clock, and, after some delay, proceeded to empannel a Jury to try the case of Charles Graham, an Englishman, who was arraigned for the murder of John Wilson, on the 8th June last, by stabbing him with a sheath knife on board the ship Knickerbocker, off Pier No. 6 North River.

headline.main: FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE.; EGYPT SENDING TROOPS. The Markets, Exchange, &c. INTENTIONS IN THE BALTIC. MOVEMENTS OF THE RUSSIANS. ARRIVAL OF THE UNION. DETAILS OF THE CRIMEAN EXPEDITION. THE ALLIES IN SPIRITS.

docs.lead_paragraph: By the arrival Wednesday morning of the United States Mail steamship Union, Capt. ADAMS we have dates from London, Southampton at 0 P.M. of the 27th.
